business.headline: IndiGo, Air France-KLM, Virgin Atlantic join hands to enhance travel to US, EuropeTo enhance air connectivity from India to Europe and North America, IndiGo, Delta Air Lines, Air France-KLM and Virgin Atlantic announced a partnership.

India orders IndiGo to end agreement with Turkish Airlines amid diplomatic tensionsThe Indian government has ordered IndiGo Airlines to terminate its damp lease agreement with Turkish Airlines by August 31. This decision comes in response to Turkey's continued support for Pakistan against India. The aviation regulator DGCA has granted a final three-month extension to the current lease, which was set to expire on May 31. IndiGo is currently operating two Boeing aircraft on damp lease from Turkish Airlines. The move is part of India's broader response to Turkey's actions, including supplying arms to Pakistan and condemning India's Operation Sindhu.

India reduces import tax on crude edible oils by 10% to bring down food pricesThe reduction in import tax will effectively bring down the total import duty on the three oils to 16.5 per cent from an earlier 27.5 per cent.

IndiGo to cut ties with Turkish Airlines amid row over Ankara's support to PakThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation said IndiGo gave an undertaking that it will terminate the lease with Turkish Airlines by August 31 and will not seek a further extension.

ITR-1 and ITR-4 Excel utilities out: Check who can file and what's new this yearExcel utilities for ITR-1 and ITR-4 are now available for AY 2025–26. Taxpayers can visit the income tax e-filing site to download and use them for filing returns for FY 2024–25.
Gensol misses May payment for loan on BluSmart cabs: ReportGensol Engineering reportedly missed a payment of about Rs 4 crore to its pass-through certificate (PTC) holders in May.
India's economic growth hits 4-year low of 6.5% in FY25The real GDP growth for the March quarter (Q4) stood at 7.4%, which is the fastest among all four quarters of the year.
Sensex closes 182 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; IT stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 182 points to end at 81,451.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 82.90 points to close at 24,750.70.

From UPI withdrawals to online corrections: 5 expected features of EPFO 3.0EPFO's upcoming system aims to enhance financial flexibility for employees with features like instant UPI and ATM withdrawals, auto-claim settlements, and expanded withdrawal reasons.

Meet Leena Tewari, the USV chairperson who bought India's costliest flatsLeena is the chairperson of USV, a Mumbai-based pharmaceutical company, which was started by her late father, Vithal Gandhi, in partnership with Revlon in 1961. Forbes estimates Leena's net worth at $3.9 billion, as of May 30, 2025, making her one of India's richest women.

Explained: Why Arshad Warsi, wife Maria Goretti were banned by Sebi for 1 yearArshad Warsi and Maria Goretti bought shares of Sadhna Broadcast Limited (now known as Crystal Business System Ltd) from other individuals who were also named in the Sebi order.

How Trump's tariff tsunami is reshaping global economyIn just over four months, Trump's flurry of trade actions, alternating between shock-and-awe tariffs and strategic pauses, has upended conventional expectations.

Waiting for Form 16? Here's when will you get it and what to checkEmployers are required to issue Form 16 to employees if they've deducted TDS from their salary. It consists of two parts and shows how much salary was paid and how much tax was deducted during the year.

Arshad Warsi, his wife, among 59 people banned from stock market for 1 yearSebi said the group was part of a scheme to artificially raise the price of Sadhna Broadcast shares before selling them to unsuspecting retail investors.

Veteran investor explains why most investors fail in marketsAce investor Shankar Sharma said many investors fail to ask tough questions and instead rely on myths. He was critical of the belief that great investors can see into the future, dismissing it as an unrealistic myth.

India GDP data to be released today: What should investors expect?Earlier this year, the National Statistical Office had estimated that India's economy would grow by 6.5% in 2024–25, with an expected growth of 7.6% in the March quarter.

Ola Electric shares nosedive 10% after Q4 net loss. Should you buy, hold or sell?Ola Electric's Q4 numbers have laid bare the challenges facing India's EV poster child, from falling volumes and margin pressures to delays in execution. While the company's aggressive bets on electric motorcycles and rural expansion could pay off, the near-term outlook is murky.

Mazagon Dock shares snap winning streak, tumble 8%. Here's whyThe stock fell to an intraday low of Rs 3,450, retracing from Thursday's close of Rs 3,749. Around 10:07 am, shares of the company were trading 4.75% lower at Rs 3,574.40.

Suzlon Energy share price up 13% over strong Q4 results: Should you buy?Suzlon Energy stock price: The shares jumped as much as 13% in early trade, reaching an intraday high of Rs 74.30 on the BSE. This rise comes after Suzlon Energy Ltd announced a sharp rise in its quarterly profit.

Explained: Why Suzlon Energy shares rose 13% after Q4 resultsThe sharp rally came after Suzlon posted a 365% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit for Q4FY25. Profit rose to Rs 1,182 crore from Rs 254 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations increased 73% to Rs 3,773 crore, compared to Rs 2,179 crore in the year-ago period.
Sensex opens 150 points lower; Nifty below 24,800; Infosys down over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 45.58 points to 81,587.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 24.20 points to 24,857.80 as of 9:25 am.

Prostarm Info Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusProstarm Info Systems was subscribed to nearly 100 times. The IPO opened for subscription on May 27, 2025, and closed on May 29, 2025.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher today. Here's whyAt 8:14 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,950, suggesting a positive start above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,833.6. This indicates that markets may open with gains in early trade.

Stocks to watch on May 30: LIC, Baja Auto, Ola, Nykaa, Mazagaon Dock, IndiGoAs the week nears its end, investors will be looking out for key movements on Friday, May 30, especially as several companies are expected to release their quarterly earnings.
Elf beauty buys Hailey Bieber's Rhode in $1 billion dealElf will acquire Rhode for $600 million in cash and $200 million of newly issued shares of Elf Beauty common stock.

Mumbai's Dharavi to get a Rs 95,790 crore makeover in 7 yearsThe redevelopment is being led by a special purpose vehicle (SPV), Navbharat Mega Developers Private Limited (NMDPL), formed through a joint venture between the Maharashtra government's Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) and the Adani Group's Dharavi Redevelopment Project Private Limited (DRPPL).

Mumbai's record home deal: USV's chairperson picks up duplexes for Rs 639 croreThese sea-facing homes are in the high-end 40-storey Naman Xana building on Worli Sea Face, offering stunning views of the Arabian Sea. The duplexes are spread across four floors – from the 32nd to the 35th, covering a total area of 22,572 sq ft.
Sensex ends 321 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; IndusInd Bank up over 2%The BSE Sensex ended 320.70 points higher at 81,633.02, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 81.15 points higher at 24,833.60.

From PF access to free Aadhaar update: 5 key financial changes in June 2025The deadline to update your Aadhaar details online for free is June 14, 2025. Those who fail to update their identity and address proof documents by this date will incur a fee of Rs 25 for updates through the online portal or Rs 50 at physical Aadhaar centres.

ITR-1 or ITR-2: Know which form suits your 2025-26 tax filingAn informative guide on choosing between ITR-1 and ITR-2 for salaried individuals, highlighting the eligibility criteria and recent updates.

ITR deadline extended for many, but not all. Are you among the exceptions?While most taxpayers have extra time to file their returns, not everyone's in the safe zone. If audit rules apply to you, your deadline hasn't moved. Does your name fall on the exception list? Let's find out here.

New pension rules for PSU employees: Key things to knowUnder the newly notified Central Civil Services (Pension) Amendment Rules, 2025, any PSU employee dismissed or removed after absorption due to misconduct could forfeit their PSU-related benefits and pension entitlements earned during their earlier government service.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares are in focus todayIndusInd Bank shares were trading 0.62% higher at Rs 809.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 9:42 am.

Sensex, Nifty rise as US court blocks Trump's tariffs, IT stocks rallyThe BSE Sensex was trading 424.23 points higher at 81,736.55 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 89.80 points to trade at 24,842.25. Most of the broader market indices also rose, reflecting the positive sentiments on Dalal Street.

Delhi startup founder says salary stagnation is breaking India's middle classThe startup founder has criticised India's economic policies for overlooking the salaried middle class, who contribute heavily to tax collections and consumer demand but receive little in return.
Stock Market Today: Sensex, Nifty set for positive opening todayGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,836 as of 8:58 am, indicating a firm start for the Nifty 50, which ended Wednesday at 24,752.45.

Stocks to watch today: IndusInd Bank, IRCTC, Adani Ports, Suzlon in focusKeep an eye on IndusInd Bank, Adani Ports, SAIL, IRCTC, and Cummins India today, as earnings, regulatory action, and fundraising updates drive sentiment in the final stretch of May.

India, US may agree on interim trade deal by June 25: SourcesAn interim trade pact between India and the US may be agreed upon by June 25, according to sources. A team of US officials is expected to visit India next month for trade talks.

Filing ITR late? You can earn 33% more interest on tax refunds this yearIf you've paid extra tax via TDS, advance tax, or self-assessment, you're entitled to a refund. As per Section 244A of the Income Tax Act, the department pays 0.5% monthly interest on the excess.

entertainment.headline: Shah Rukh Khan's ripped and tattooed avatar leaves fans amazedShah Rukh Khan recently stunned fans with a new avatar, showcasing a muscular physique and flaunting his tattoos.

Bohot sharafat se... Actor Mumtaz recalls Yash Chopra's marriage proposalVeteran actor Mumtaz recalled once being proposed by the late filmmaker Yash Chopra. The 77-year-old spoke about her priorities at that time as an aspirational young actor.

Aamir Khan calls marriage to Reena Dutta jawani ka josh: Timing was a mistakeActor Aamir Khan reflected upon 16 years of marriage to Reena Dutta. The actor shared that he doesn't regret marrying Reena, because in her, he found a friend for life, but the timing of the marriage.

BTS kicks off 2025 FESTA with laughter, legacy, and Bangtan vibesBTS has launched the '2025 BTS FESTA' to celebrate their 12th debut anniversary, marking a heartfelt and playful reunion stage for the group post military service. The event sets the tone for an eagerly awaited full-group comeback later this year or early next year.

Actor Sreeleela sits in basket, shares family celebration before birthday. PicsActor Sreeleela shared a nostalgic pre-birthday post on social media with her family. In the pictures, she is seen dressed traditionally, sitting in a basket as her family members shower her with blessings and love.

Time exposes, says director Raj Nidimoru's wife amid rumours of him dating SamanthaAs the rumours of Samantha dating director Raj Nidimoru spread on social media, his wife, Shyyamali De, shared a cryptic note on Instagram, mentioning 'karma' and 'time'.

Hope I die with my shoes on: Aamir Khan says Mahabharat could be his last spectacleAamir Khan recently spoke about the possibility of his ambitious project based on the epic Mahabharat. He also hinted at it being the final film project of his career after 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The actor reflected on the reason why he felt so.

Stranger Things 5 to have 3 parts: Plot, cast, release date - all you need to know'Stranger Things Season 5' finale will release on New Year's Eve. Netflix has split the last season into three parts. Here's all you need to know about one of the most celebrated fantasy thrillers.

Indian TV was better in the 90s - and it's not just nostalgiaWhen television was a reflection of life, not a cacophony of drama and excess, the golden era of Indian TV in the 90s brought stories that resonated with the soul and characters that felt like family.

Accepting blessings again: Actor Nakuul Mehta, Jankee announce second pregnancy'Ishqbaaz' star Nakuul Mehta is going to welcome his second child with wife Jankee soon. The couple announced good news with a few pictures on social media.

Squid Game 3 trailer: Equal parts chilling and excitingSeveral characters who were not given enough screen time in Season 2, reappear in Season 3 with more. The trailer of 'Squid Game Season 3' features deadlier games and an iconic face-off.

Won't allow Thug Life's release: Protests against Kamal Haasan intensifyActor Kamal Haasan's effigies were burnt across Karnataka as protests against the actor intensified amid the language row. His film, 'Thug Life', is scheduled to release on June 5.

Khaleja re-release box office Day 2: Mahesh Babu's film hunts records globallyMahesh Babu's 'Khaleja' re-released in theatres on May 30, and the film has already started setting fresh records at the box office. It has emerged as the biggest Indian re-release opener in North America.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 9: Rajkummar Rao's film smashes Rs 50 crore mark'Bhool Chuk Maaf' has entered its second weekend at the box office. The film has seen fantastic growth in its second Saturday collection, moving past the benchmark of Rs 50 crore.

Nagarjuna invites Revanth Reddy to younger son Akhil Akkineni-Zainab's weddingActor Nagarjuna met Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy to extend the invitation to his son Akhil Akkineni's wedding with Zainab Ravdjee. He was accompanied by his wife Amala and the bride's parents.

Dhanush, Aishwarya Rajinikanth come together for son's school graduation. PicsDhanush and Aishwarya Rajinikanth were proud parents as their eldest son, Yathra, graduated from school. The couple got divorced in November 2024.

Bring back Chinmayi: Samantha supports singer after being shadow-banned for 8 yearsActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared singer Chinmayi Sripada's viral clip from 'Thug Life' music launch event. She questioned the ban on the singer since 2018.

general news.headline: 40 Russian aircraft downed in Ukraine's massive drone attack on air base: ReportUkrainian drones attacked a military unit in the Sredny settlement in Russia's Irkutsk region, local authorities claimed.

Even Pak did it: Congress reiterates demand for Parliament session on Op SindoorAddressing reporters, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said that the Centre should take a cue from Pakistan, which has convened its Parliament and held deliberations on the developments, and show similar seriousness in addressing the matter.

Dust storm, heavy rain in parts of Delhi-NCR, airport ops affectedVideos from various parts of Delhi-NCR showed intense winds and thick dust storms hitting the area, reducing visibility and prompting people to seek shelter. The sudden weather change led to a noticeable drop in temperature, offering a brief but welcome respite from the heat.

Punjab Kings, who were beaten by Royal Challengers Bengaluru in Qualifier 1, will be hoping for a better show with the bat. The big match is just an hour away now.

In tiger territory, LPG and toilet emerge as big lifesaversIn tiger territories across India, a humble toilet and LPG connection at home are saving precious lives. This success story of the Swachh Bharat Yojana and the Ujjwala scheme is unfolding in faraway forests even as overall deaths from tiger attacks rise in India.

Secularism must..: Pawan Kalyan, Kangana question Sharmistha Panoli's arrestInfluencer Sharmistha Panoli was arrested by Kolkata Police from Gurugram over a social media post on Operation Sindoor which drew massive backlash. Multiple FIRs were filed against Panoli after she allegedly used abusive and politically-charged language in the video.

Mamata Banerjee opened borders to Bangladeshis, can't stop infiltration: Amit ShahSounding the poll bugle in West Bengal ahead of the 2026 Assembly elections, Amit Shah said the elections in the state will not only determine the future of Bengal but also have implications for national security.

Why did defence chief speak from Singapore? Congress rebuke with Vajpayee lessonCongress leader Jairam Ramesh said CDS General Anil Chauhan's admission of military losses during Operation Sindoor warrants serious political discussion and criticised the Defence Minister for not briefing political parties before such revelations were made abroad.

Viral post, arrest and political slugfest: What's the Sharmistha Panoli controversyA political slugfest erupted after the arrest of 22-year-old social media influencer Sharmistha Panoli over a controversial video on Operation Sindoor. The 22-year-old law student was booked after she used abusive and communally-charged language in her video.

Sheikh Hasina charged with crimes against humanity during Bangladesh protestsSheikh Hasina, former Bangladesh Prime Minister, has been charged with crimes against humanity for allegedly ordering violent crackdowns during the 2024 student-led uprising.

50 bombs, 30 seconds: How Israel eliminated Hamas top commander Muhammad SinwarNearly three weeks after a deadly Israeli airstrike in Gaza, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) released footage it claimed shows a Hamas command center beneath a hospital where key operatives, including Muhammad Sinwar, were killed.

Stop blaming others: India rips Pak at UN meet over Indus Waters Treaty remarkIndia dismissed Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's remarks on the Indus Waters Treaty as unwarranted, asserting at a UN conference that Islamabad's support for cross-border terrorism is the real obstacle to the treaty's implementation.

Chairs thrown at UP wedding after baraatis clash over cooler. Video goes viralA wedding in Jhansi turned chaotic after a fight broke out between guests over a cooler. A viral video of the incident shows several people hurling chairs at each other.

3,800 hit as heavy rain in Manipur maroons localities, damages several housesTwo people were injured and 3,802 individuals were affected as flash floods triggered by torrential rain in Manipur caused rivers to overflow, damaged 883 houses and killed 64 domestic animals.

363 fresh cases take India's Covid tally past 3,700-mark; 4 deaths reportedIndia's active Covid-19 caseload has surged over 14-fold in ten days, driven by Omicron subvariants, with Kerala reporting the highest number of cases.

All eyes on Sharmistha Panoli: Dutch MP backs student arrested for Op Sindoor post

Sharmistha Panoli's arrest by Kolkata Police over a controversial tweet targeting a particular community in connection with Operation Sindoor has sparked widespread criticism of the Bengal government. A Dutch parliamentarian has urged PM Modi to 'help' her, while the BJP has accused Mamata Banerjee of appeasement.

Giant solar explosion to hit Earth today, trigger geomagnetic stormNasa and Noaa models agree that the explosion will strike our planet sometime on June 1.

PSG win sparks clashes in France; 17-year-old among 2 killed, hundreds arrestedThousands of supporters thronged the streets of Paris to celebrate PSG's win over Inter Milan in Munich. However, violent protests broke out soon after, prompting Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau to say, 'Barbarians have taken to the streets of Paris.'

31 killed, many injured in attack near Gaza aid centre, Israel denies roleAt least 31 Palestinians were killed and many injured after Israeli forces opened fire near a US-funded aid centre in Rafah. However, Israel has dismissed the reports, saying all slander works when it comes to Israel.

Didn't do drugs, I tried...: What Elon Musk said on bombshell NYT report claimsAccording to sources cited in the NYT report, Elon Musk regularly consumed ketamine, ecstasy and psychedelic mushrooms, raising alarm given his government advisory role.

sports.headline: Manchester United announce Matheus Cunha as 1st signing of summer transfer windowManchester United have announced Matheus Cunha as their first signing of the summer from Wolverhampton Wanderers on Sunday, June 1. Cunha was a star for Wolves last season as they escaped relegation.

French Open: Elina Svitolina saves 3 match points to stun Jasmine PaoliniElina Svitolina produced a stunning comeback by saving three match points to stun 2024 finalist Jasmine Paolini on Sunday, June 1. Svitolina made it to her 13th grand slam quarterfinal with the win over Paolini.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
